title: Reference to glob-imported private member gives error E0412 instead of E0603

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
foo.rs:

```rust
struct Foo;
```

main.rs:

```rust
mod foo;
use foo::*;

fn main() {
    let foo: Foo;
}
```

Returns an error:

```rust
error[E0412]: cannot find type `Foo` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:5:14
  |
5 |     let foo: Foo;
  |              ^^^ not found in this scope
help: possible candidate is found in another module, you can import it into scope
  |
2 | use foo::Foo;
  |

warning: unused import: `foo::*`
 --> src/main.rs:2:5
  |
2 | use foo::*;
  |     ^^^^^^
  |
  = note: #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0412`.
error: Could not compile `temp`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
Makefile:15: recipe for target 'build' failed
make: *** [build] Error 101

```

The suggestion is to add `use foo::Foo` to `main.rs`, but that `use` is already covered by `use foo::*;`. Adding that to `main.rs` anyway returns the correct error that should have been returned in the first place:

```rust
error[E0603]: struct `Foo` is private
 --> src/main.rs:3:5
  |
3 | use foo::Foo;
  |     ^^^^^^^^

warning: unused import: `foo::*`
 --> src/main.rs:2:5
  |
2 | use foo::*;
  |     ^^^^^^
  |
  = note: #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0603`.
error: Could not compile `temp`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
Makefile:15: recipe for target 'build' failed
make: *** [build] Error 101
```
